title: Spotify Album Rater
description: Built a full-stack Flask web application that allows users to search, rate, and review music albums by integrating the Spotify Web API via spotipy
Designed relational data models and full CRUD functionality for albums and ratings with form validation
Implemented secure authentication and admin moderation using Flask-Login and SQLAlchemy

title: Shapley Routing Python API
description: Designed and integrated an algorithm to compute exact Shapley values for ride-sharing games, facilitating fair cost allocation among participants
Developed an efficient method for approximating Shapley values in ride-sharing scenarios with many participants, based on the Appro-O(1) approach by Popescu and Kilby

title: Indoor GPS Navigation System
description: Designed and developed an assistive mobile application that provides indoor auditory navigation for visually impaired users
Built a mobile client UI in React Native, optimized for accessibility with screen reader support, text-to-speech integration, high-contrast visuals, and simplified navigation flow
Implemented building mapping workflow, allowing users to graph rooms, hallways, and points of interest based on uploaded floor plans and GPS coordinates
Developed a backend server in Django connected to a PostgreSQL database to store maps of multiple buildings with several floors
Leveraged onboard smartphone accelerometer, GPS, and Bluetooth to estimate user movement and position with under 5m error tolerance
Implemented and tested LIDAR-based obstacle detection system, providing sub-1 second latency collision alerts with under 1m warning distance
Designed and prototyped a 3D-printed smartphone mount in SolidWorks to securely house an Arduino and LIDAR sensor

title: Autonomous Intake and Climbing Robot
description: Entry for First Robotics' Robot in 3 Days Competition
Developed software for intake and climbing subsystems in Java, including motor control and behavior logic
Mapped subsystem controls to a gamepad interface, configuring button and axis inputs for intuitive robot operation
Contributed to mechanical design and fabrication of an aluminum claw mechanism for climbing and elevation
Machined components and assembled a winch-powered lifting system for bar-latching and self-hoisting functionality

title: Line Following Music Player
description: Entry for Zero Robotics Competition
Designed a line-following robot that plays musical notes based on line shading
Focused on electrical system design, fabricating a custom circuit layout on an aluminum chassis for balanced weight distribution
Built and wired an Arduino-powered circuit, integrating an R-2R digital-to-analog converter to generate musical tones
Implemented motor control circuitry for real-time line following using a color sensor to interpret line shading

title: Home Security Monitoring System
description: Entry for EngHack Competition
Developed a portable Arduino-powered sensor box to detect audio and motion events for home security
Wired and assembled hardware components including motion sensors and microphones for real-time monitoring
Programmed the Arduino to serialize sensor data and transmit it to a user's computer for processing
Built a Processing script to receive sensor data and feed it into a web interface for user alerts and monitoring
Contributed to a machine learning script for analyzing captured audio and identifying user intent, including detection of politically charged language

title: UW Mars Rover Team
description: Entry for University Rover Challenge
Developed autonomous path-finding algorithms using Python and ROS for desert navigation
Integrated computer vision and GPS data to locate and recover objects with relative positioning
Built and tested real-time autonomy systems for GPS-guided search and retrieval tasks

title: Guitar Playing Robot
description: Designed, built, and programmed a robot that plays power chords on an acoustic guitar
Used multithreaded programming to optimize play timing and sound clarity
Wrote driver tasks to test functionality and improve code reliability and efficiency
Constructed the robot chassis, including a strumming arm and a 3-axis gantry system for fret positioning
Successfully performed "Smoke on the Water" and "Free Fallin'", with clearly recognizable playback

title: Pick and Place Robot Arm
description: Entry for Mechatronics Competition
Engineered a remote-controlled robotic arm to move objects across a pegboard, achieving 90% in design and efficiency scoring
Designed and implemented a pulley-assisted elevation system to counterbalance the weight of the final arm segment
Developed a C++ control program to optimize arm joint angles and positioning for maximum speed and reach

title: Charity Recommendation Platform
description: Entry for Hack the North
Led back-end development, focusing on data integration and API communication
Built a dynamic data system using the Google Firebase API to manage charity information
Integrated the Twitter API to analyze trending topics and align them with relevant charitable foundations
